Package org.jtrim2.cache

Class GenericReference

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.cache.GenericReference
public final class GenericReference extends Object
Contains static methods to create volatile references backed by the JVM. Note that you can also use ObjectCache.javaRefCache() for this purpose. These methods are only for convenience when no ObjectCache is needed.
See Also:
  • ObjectCache.javaRefCache()

  • Method Details

    • createReference

      public static <T> VolatileReference<T> createReference(T referent, ReferenceType refType)
      Returns a volatile reference of the passed object that is directly backed by the JVM. The reference type must be specified for determining how the passed object will be referenced.

      The returned volatile reference will maintain the following Java reference types for the specified reference types:

      • HardRefType: hard reference (the commonly used simple reference), the referred object will never disappear unless the volatile reference is cleared
      • SoftRefType: soft reference
      • WeakRefType: weak reference
      • UserRefType: not referenced
      • NoRefType: not referenced
      Note that after the returned volatile reference is cleared the object will no longer reachable in anyway from the returned volatile reference.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to be referenced
      Parameters:
      referent - the object to referenced. The returned volatile reference will return this object or null. This argument can be null.
      refType - the required reference type. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the volatile reference of the passed object. This method will never return null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the reference type is null

    • createHardReference

      public static <T> VolatileReference<T> createHardReference(T referent)
      Returns a volatile reference that stores a hard reference to the specified object. The passed object will never disappear from the returned volatile reference unless it is explicitly cleared.

      This method is effectively equivalent to: createReference(referent, ReferenceType.HardRefType).

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the referred object
      Parameters:
      referent - the object to referenced. The returned volatile reference will return this object or null if it was cleared. This argument can be null.
      Returns:
      the volatile reference of the specified object. This argument will never return null and the returned volatile reference will only lose its referred object if it was explicitly cleared.

    • createSoftReference

      public static <T> VolatileReference<T> createSoftReference(T referent)
      Returns a volatile reference which stores a soft reference to the specified object. The passed object is expected to disappear from the returned volatile reference only if the JVM decides that it needs more memory. The JVM is required to clear this reference before throwing an OutOfMemoryError.

      This method is effectively equivalent to: createReference(referent, ReferenceType.SoftRefType).

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the referred object
      Parameters:
      referent - the object to referenced. The returned volatile reference will return this object or null. This argument can be null.
      Returns:
      the volatile reference of the specified object. This argument will never return null.

    • createWeakReference

      public static <T> VolatileReference<T> createWeakReference(T referent)
      Returns a volatile reference which stores a weak reference to the specified object. The passed object is expected to disappear from the returned volatile reference if the garbage collector decides to clean up references (the garbage collector will not try to keep this reference if there are only weak references to the object). The JVM is required to clear this reference before throwing an OutOfMemoryError.

      This method is effectively equivalent to: createReference(referent, ReferenceType.WeakRefType).

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the referred object
      Parameters:
      referent - the object to referenced. The returned volatile reference will return this object or null. This argument can be null.
      Returns:
      the volatile reference of the specified object. This argument will never return null.

    • getNoReference

      public static <T> VolatileReference<T> getNoReference()
      Returns a volatile reference which always returns null. This method is expected to be used where an interface requires a volatile reference and the actual object is not available. Note that every general user must be able to handle this reference since from their point of view this reference is equivalent to an already cleared reference.

      This method is effectively equivalent to: createReference(referent, ReferenceType.NoRefType).

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the (virtually) referred object. Note that no instance of this type need to exists.
      Returns:
      the volatile reference which always returns null. This argument will never return null and is immutable, so it can be shared safely across threads.
